doc:
Marlee Matlin https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Marlee_Matlin 0 Marlee Beth Matlin (born August 24, 1965) is an American actress, author, and activist. She won the Academy Award for Best Actress for Children of a Lesser God (1986) and to date is the only deaf performer to have won an Academy Award. Her work in film and television has resulted in a Golden Globe award, with two additional nominations, and four Emmy nominations. Deaf since she was 18 months old, due to illness and high fevers, she is also a prominent member of the National Association of the Deaf. Her longtime interpreter is Jack Jason. Marlee_Beth_Matlin ( born August_24 , 1965 ) is an_American_actress , author , and activist . She won the_Academy_Award for_Best_Actress for Children of a_Lesser_God_(_1986_) and to date is the_only_deaf_performer to_have_won an_Academy_Award . Her_work in film_and_television has_resulted in a_Golden_Globe_award , with two_additional_nominations , and four_Emmy_nominations . Deaf since she was 18_months old , due to illness_and_high_fevers , she is also a_prominent_member of the_National_Association of the_Deaf . Her_longtime_interpreter is Jack_Jason .
